intro: Stenostomum imbricatum, commonly known as the silverleaf stenostomum, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Stenostomum imbricatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
